page.title: 12TRANSPORT IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: Godmersham lies on the A28 road, from Ashford to Canterbury. Traffic is heavy with Lorries travelling to the nearby motorways. BUS SERVICE is good with 13 services a day in one direction, the first at 7.08am and the last at 7.40pm. It is poorly supported. The Post Bus carries post and passengers to outlying areas twice a day. SCHOOL TRANSPORT is provided by private coaches to Ashford for the secondary children and to Wye for the primary children. Children in outlying areas are collected by taxi and a minibus transports the handicapped. PRIVATE CARS are used by the majority of residents. MOPEDS and BICYCLES are used by a small percentage for shopping and travel to work
